title: Doflamingo's Protective or Manipulative Control Over Baby 5
theory: The revelation that Doflamingo killed all eight of Baby 5's fianc√©s and destroyed their hometowns raises questions about his motivations. Buffalo claims Doflamingo did this out of protective love, viewing Baby 5 as a sister and protecting her from exploitative suitors who took advantage of her psychological need to be needed. However, fans debate whether this is genuine protection or a form of manipulation and control that keeps Baby 5 dependent on Doflamingo and the crew, preventing her from having autonomy or relationships outside his influence.
author: One Piece community discussions

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Contains implications about Doflamingo's controlling nature that are explored further in the Dressrosa Arc

evidence: Baby 5 has a pattern of accepting every proposal due to her psychological need to be needed
Baby 5 has accumulated 98 million debt from lending money to people
Doflamingo destroyed entire towns, not just eliminated individuals
Buffalo defends Doflamingo's actions as protective
Baby 5 remains loyal to Doflamingo despite her complaints
resolution: Later episodes reveal more about Doflamingo's controlling leadership style and Baby 5's eventual departure from the crew
